April 20, 1967
Honorable Jacob K. Javits
United States Senator
320 Old Senate Office Building
Washington, 0. C.
Dear Senator Javits:
Mr* Albert Fredette, Manager of Station WAMC-FM,
The Albany Medical College, indicated to us several
weeks ago, after a visifc with Mr. Grossman, your
Legislative Assistant, that you would be interested
in receiving further information on Educational
Radio.
Mr. Jerrold Sandler, Executive Director of National
Educational Radio, who is presently out-of-town, has
requested me to forward some information on his
behalf which may be of some help and interest to
you. Because of his tight schedule of these past
weeks due to the hearings on S. 1160, it has been
impossible for him to reply in person to you. He
has, however, expressed a deep appreciation of your
interest and efforts on behalf of Educational Radio.
You should have already received a copy of 'THE
HIDDEN MEDIUM: A Status Report on Educational Radio”.
This comprehensive report presents an indepth study
of the status and needs of Educational Radio in the
United States today. Section V-l through V-6 of this
report deals specifically with the contributions of
station WAMC-FM, The Albany Medical College, to the
field of professional as well as enrichment communi¬
cations, which may be of particular interest to you.
I am enclosing with this letter an additional copy
of the summary of the report which you may find of
some use.
Also enclosed is a copy of Mr. Sandler's written
testimony which was submitted to the Senate Sub¬
committee on Communications April 14 as part of the
hearings on the Public Television Act of 1967.
